BackEnd

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • BackEnd.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls the flow of game, lets the UI know what choices the player has and the state of the game. Also lets the UI tell it the User choices, basicly acts and an API for the front end.
    Author:
    Christian Sanger

      • drawnCard

        public Tile drawnCard()
        Returns the last drawn card of the current player.
        Returns:
        the tile the player is holding.

      • getSlideLocations

        public Coordinate[] getSlideLocations()
        gets the current slide locations that the player can push a tile in. All slide locations will be outside of board. ie. to push in from the left to the right on the top row location (-1,0) would be used.
        Returns:
        list of every allowed slide location

      • floor

        public void floor(FloorTile tile,
                  Coordinate location)
        Used to tell the game where the user would like to slide a tile in.
        Parameters:
        tile - tile to be played
        location - where the tile should be played.

      • getPlayersThatCanBeBacktracked

        public boolean[] getPlayersThatCanBeBacktracked()
        Tells you which players have already been backtracked
        Returns:
        array where each [0] is the first player.

      • getPlayerLocations

        public Coordinate[] getPlayerLocations()
        array where each player is location, as a Coordinate.
        Returns:
        the current locations of the players

      • action

        public void action(ActionTile tile,

        Plays an Action tile at location.
        Parameters:

        coordinate - where it would like to be played

        Returns:
